sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: At least seven people have been injured in an attack on Dnipro, as Ukraine says it has returned power to its Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis says he won't form a coalition government, as Greece heads for a second election in June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: American tech company Meta has been handed a European record fine of 1.2 billion euros for data transfer breaches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: EU foreign affairs ministers fail to agree on a new round of money to finance weapons shipments to Ukraine as Hungary holds up the decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Emergency workers are cleaning up the damage left behind by attack on the Ukrainian city of Dnipro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: According to Kyiv, at least 16 missiles and 20 attack drones targeted the city overnight, injuring seven people, including two women in their 50s and 70s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Officials say they haven't seen an attack of this scale since the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukraine has reconnected the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant to its power supply after it experienced a brief outage, which each side has blamed the other for causing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This marks the seventh time that power has been cut from Europe's largest nuclear power plant since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere in Bakhmut, Ukrainian forces say they still control small parts of the embattled eastern city, despite Russian claims that it fell over the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The grinding fight for the city has been one of the bloodiest of the war, and it has killed tens of thousands of fighters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Monday he will not seek to form a coalition government and quickly returned the exploratory mandate he received from the Greek president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: He told President Sakhala Rapoulu that there are no conditions under which his party could enter government with its opponents. Είπε ο Πρόεδρος Σακελαροπολού ότι δεν υπάρχουν κανένα σημεία όπου η κυβέρνηση του κυβέρνησης μπορεί να εμπιστευτεί με τις αντιμετωπίες της.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Είναι ένα πρωτοκλητικό σύστημα που θα ισχύσει στις επόμενες εκλογές.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Η Νέα Δημοκρατία θα είχε ήδη μια ισχυρή κοινοβουλευτική πρωτοκρία.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Έχω μάθει στις δύσκολες στιγμές να αναλαμβάνω την ευθύνη και να μην εγκαταλείπω τη μάχη.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Είμαι εδώ. Δεν θα εγκαταλείψω ούτε τώρα, στη μέση μάλιστα ενός δύσκολου αγώνα. I will not give up the fight. I am here. I will not give up even now, in the midst of a difficult struggle. Greece is set to vote in new elections in June,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: despite their country's New Democracy Party getting double the votes of left-wing opponent Syriza on Sunday, creating the most decisive margin in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is because a one-off election law in place prevented it from claiming an outright majority in its general election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But many voters believe that the ruling party will come out on top during the next election. και το αποτρέπησε από την εκκλησία μιας αυτοκρατικής μεταξύτησης στην κυβέρνηση. Αλλά πολλοί εκλογές πιστεύναμης κυβέρνησης... Εννοείται, αλλιώς δεν γίνεται κάτι άλλο.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Φαινόταν ότι θα κερδίσει μπροστά με 10 μονάδες, 20 τώρα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Έτσι πει τα προγνωστικά που βλέπαμε.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ο πρωθυπουργός του Ν.Δ. Π.Κ. Μητσοτάκης έχει προσπαθήσει να συνεχίσει ταξίδια, να αυξήσει το εμπλήρωμα, να αυξήσει το εμπλήρωμα του κοινωνικού κλάσου και να αυξήσει τις εξοπλήρες.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Υπότιτλοι AUTHORWAVE να υπηρετήσει παραπέρα τούτην πατρίδα που έχει προβλήματα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Και ανεργία υπάρχει, και εγκληματικότητα υπάρχει και τα πάντα υπάρχουν.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Αν αδιορθωθούν, τι να πω, εύχομαι να πάνε όλα καλά.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Παρά το ότι τα προβλήματα της καθημερινότητας επιμένουν και παραμένουν, η επιλογή του κόσμου, την Κυριακή των εκλογών, δεν επιδέχεται περαιτέρω ερμηνείας αν κρίνουμε με βάση τους αριθμούς.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Τώρα το αν οι πολίτες θα επιβεβαιωθούν για την επιλογή τους ή αν θα διαψευστούν μένει να το δούμε το επόμενο χρονικό διάστημα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Από την Αθήνα για το Euro News, Πάνος Κιτσικόπουλος. Facebook parent group Meta has been slapped with a 1.2 billion euro fine for violating

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: European data protection laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Irish Data Protection Commission has ordered the American tech giant to stop any further transfer of European personal data to the United States and has been given five months to comply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The company is expected to appeal the verdict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The current decision relates exclusively to Facebook, not to other services from the Meta Corporation, such as Instagram or WhatsApp.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: However, legal proceedings could drag on for years, and it is possible that by the time a final decision is reached, there will be a new regulation between the EU and the US regarding the handling of transatlantic data traffic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The record-breaking sum exceeds the highest fine imposed by the DPC on Amazon. and the US regarding the handling of transatlantic data traffic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The record-breaking sum exceeds the highest fine imposed by the DPC on Amazon of 746 million euros in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A decade and a half after her disappearance, police in Portugal have launched a new search for the body of Madeleine McCann.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: At the request of police in Germany, they are looking for the British girl in the Arad Dam, located 50 kilometers from the resort in the Algarve region, where she disappeared in 2007.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Searches are expected to begin on Tuesday, with British police also present.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This place was frequented by the main suspect, convicted pedophile Christian Buckner, who was imprisoned in Germany for other crimes and has a long history of sexual abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: McCann was just three years old when she disappeared from a room she was sleeping in with her two younger brothers at a resort in Praia da Luz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Taking to the streets, there's 20,000 people in Brussels protest on Monday against what they describe as attacks on the right to strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's part of a general demonstration called by Belgian unions after the federal government announced its intention to go ahead with a new law banning rioters from taking part in demonstrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's why people are protesting in prison ware.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's what might happen if we don't hurry to block the laws that are being implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Today, protesting, negotiating, becomes repressed by the law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And so today, we wanted to show that if we don't do anything, that's how we'll protest tomorrow. Demonstrators are also angry about a series of recent judicial decisions that oblige protesters to lift their blockades in front of Belgian supermarket chain Delhaize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's been ongoing for three months now against the franchising of the company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's been ongoing for three months now against the franchising of the company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Unions say the proposed law could perpetuate these practices against picketing. The demonstrators describe what's happening in Belgium as social dumping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: They say they will continue fighting against it to risk its spreading to other sectors. Belarusian opposition activist Roman Protasevich has been pardoned by Belarusian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Protasevich was accused of coordinating mass protests against President Alexander Lukashenko in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: He was arrested in 2021 after his flight to Lithuania was forced to land in Minsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Earlier this month, a court in Minsk sentenced the 28-year-old to eight years in a penal colony. Belarusian state news agency Belta reported that Protasevich's charges would be dropped. In a video statement, he issued a string of apologetic statements, which his family have said were forced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: EU foreign affairs ministers fail to agree on a new round of money to finance weapons

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: shipments to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The bloc is willing to allocate another 500 million euros from its European peace facility in order to support Kyiv in its fight against the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But Hungary's government is blocking the decision because the country's biggest bank, OTP Bank, appears on Ukraine's list of what it agency blacklisted the Hungarian bank because they say it provides preferential credit terms to the Russian military.

That's what we are going to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's blacklist has no legal consequences, but calls on consumers to boycott these companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It also contains many European businesses in France, Italy and Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Climate change activists from the last generation movement in Italy climbed into Rome's iconic Trevi fountain and used dye to turn its waters black. They described it as a protest against the inaction of Italy's government and institutions on climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The group says the continued investment in fossil fuels is directly linked to the catastrophic flooding that has recently hit Italy's Emilia-Romagna region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Last Generation's peaceful protests have targeted other cultural sites in the past.
